required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Peripheral Sensory Input in Central Post Stroke Pain (CPSP)
clinical_study.official_title: How "Central" is Central Post-stroke Pain? Investigating the Role of Peripheral Sensory Input in Maintaining Central Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, open-label study in 10 patients with Central Post Stroke Pain (CPSP). The study will evaluate the effects of peripheral nerve blockade on spontaneous pain and evoked thermal and mechanical responses in CPSP, and assesses the associated local anesthetic pharmacokinetics.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in Spontaneous Pain Intensity After a Peripheral Nerve Block.
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in spontaneous pain intensity in the painful extremity from baseline to 30 minutes after a peripheral nerve block.Spontaneous pain intensity was measured on 0-10 numerical rating scale (NRS), where 0 represents "no pain", and 10 represents "worst pain imaginable"

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Intensity of Cold Sensation
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of cold sensation (application of roller cooled down to 20 degrees Celsius) was measured on 0-10 scale, where 5 represents "normal" sensation (comparable to contralateral non-painful extremity). Higher scores indicate increased sensitivity (10= painful cold); lower scores represent reduced sensitivity (0=no cold sensation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Intensity of Warm Sensation
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of warm sensation (application of roller heated up to 40 degrees Celsius) was measured on 0-10 scale, where 5 represents "normal" sensation (comparable to contralateral non-painful extremity). Higher scores indicate increased sensitivity (10= painful hot); lower scores represent reduced sensitivity (0=no warmth sensation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Intensity of Pinprick Sensation
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of pinprick sensation (application of Semmes-Weinstein monofilament #6.1, ~100g target force) was measured on 0-10 scale, where 5 represents "normal" sensation (comparable to contralateral non-painful extremity). Higher scores indicate increased sensitivity (10= painful sharp); lower scores represent reduced sensitivity (0=no pricking sensation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Intensity of Brush Sensation
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of brush sensation (application of SENSELab Brush-05) was measured on 0-10 scale, where 5 represents "normal" sensation (comparable to contralateral non-painful extremity). Higher scores indicate increased sensitivity (10= painful brushing sensation); lower scores represent reduced sensitivity (0=no brushing sensation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Reported Pain/Dysesthesia Descriptors on NPSI Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Composite scores on NPSI (Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory) questionnaire before and 40 minutes after the peripheral nerve block. The NPSI assesses participant ranking of specific neuropathic pain descriptors, each ranked on a 0-10 scale, where 0 represents no burning/squeezing/electric shocks (etc), and 10 represents worst burning/squeezing/electric shocks (etc). The scores on individual questions are grouped (averaged) into the three following subscales (each subscale scores ranging from 0 to 10): Burning pain Paroxysmal pain Paresthesia/dysesthesia

arm_group.description: Completion of NPSI questionnaire Sensory mapping of the affected limb Quantitative Sensory Testing Patients will have a peripheral nerve blockade

intervention.intervention_name: Ultrasound-guided peripheral nerve block with 2% lidocaine
intervention.description: Patients will have a peripheral nerve blockade with a local anesthetic (lidocaine) Assessment of spontaneous and evoked pain responses Completion of NPSI questionnaire Mapping of the affected limb

group.title: The Entire Cohort
group.description: All participants received a peripheral nerve block

group.title: The Entire Cohort
group.description: All participants received a peripheral nerve block

event.description: Two patients reported perioral numbness for 14 and 10 minutes, respectively. Resolved spontaneously
One subject reported dizziness (for 10 minutes), resolved spontaneously
One patient experienced a vasovagal response during needle placement, but recovered uneventfully, and the study team proceeded with the block 5 minutes thereafter

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
